c74object.name: dynamic.this~
c74object.digest: The functionality of thispoly~ for dynamicdsp~ and dynamicserial~
c74object.description: dynamic.this~ allows you to determine which slot a patch is loaded into in a dynamicdsp~ or dynamicserial~ object, as well as to set the mute and busy flags for voice allocation and CPU control. You can also delete a patch from the inside, without affecting the audio processing of other patches (this also frees the slot into which the patch is loaded).

objarg.name: Audio-flag
objarg.digest: Set the intial state of the audio flag
objarg.description:
The first argument is an int to set the initial mute state of dynamic.this~.
0 (default) sets the mute flag on, preventing any audio.
1 sets the mute flag off, turning audio on.

objarg.name: busy-flag
objarg.digest: Set the intial state of the busy flag
objarg.description:
The second argument is an int to set the initial busy state of dynamic.this~.
0 (default) sets the busy flag off.
1 sets the busy flag on.

method.name: bang
method.description: Sending in a bang will cause dynamic.this~ to output when it is inside of a dynamicdsp~ or dynamicserial~.

method.name: busy
method.description:
Sending the busy message followed by an int sets the busy state of dynamic.this~.
busy / 0 sets the busy flag off.
busy / 1 sets the busy flag on.
Sending an int(0 or 1) into dynamic.this~ without the busy message works the same.

method.name: flags
method.description:
Sending the flags message followed by an int input sets the initial busy/mute state of dynamic.this~.
flags / 0 sets the busy flag off / mute flag on
flags / 1 sets the busy flag on / mute flag off

method.name: mute
method.description:
Sending the mute message followed by an int sets the mute state of dynamic.this~.
0 sets the mute flag on, preventing any audio.
1 sets the mute flag off, turning audio on.

method.name: delete
method.description: Sending dynamic.this~ the delete message will delete that patch that it is in and free up the slot it was using in the dynamicdsp~ or dynamicserial~.

entry.name: int
entry.description:
dynamic.this~ has three outlets.
The first outlet outputs the patch index (starting from 1) as an int.
The second outlet outputs the mute status as an int.
0 is unmuted
1 is muted
The third outlet outputs the busy status as an int.
0 is not busy
1 is busy
